knimeNode.name: Lipinski's Rule-of-Five
knimeNode.shortDescription: Calculates the number failures of the Lipinski's Rule Of Five.

fullDescription.intro:
The Rule of 5 got its name from the cutoff values for each of the four parameters that define the potential of a drug candidate for good absorption: all of these values are close to five or a multiple of five. The original definition, given by Christopher A. Lipinski, says that poor absorption (or permeation) is more likely when: the molecule has more than 5 H-bond donors and more than 10 H-bond acceptors, its molecular weight is over 500, and its LogP is over 5.
This node can process the input table in parallel. However, by default the usage of threads is disabled in the CDK plugin, because the CDK code may not be thread-safe in all places. If you want to enable multi-threading, change the setting in the KNIME preferences.
fullDescription.option: Select the column containing the molecular structure.

ports.inPort: Table containing molecular structure based on which the Rule-of-Five shall be computed

outPort.name: Input with failure count as separate column

ports.outPort: As input but with one additional column containing the count of failures of the rule of five
